nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: You see a suspicious-looking fortune cookie standing in line. Who knows what message this peculiar dessert can bring you.

nodes.speaker: fortune cookie
nodes.text: Psss kid. Listen, you’re surrounded by all these sugary desserts, they’re gonna give you a sugar addiction. Why not skip straight to the last part? I got the right thing for you. Baking flour.

nodes.speaker: fortune cookie
nodes.text: I got whachu need. Hand over the chips.

nodes.speaker: fortune cookie
nodes.text: Pleasure doin’ business. Don’t overdose on carbs, kid.

nodes.speaker: fortune cookie
nodes.text: You sure you got the chips for that? Don’t try to pull crumbs on me, pal.

nodes.speaker: fortune cookie
nodes.text: Why so stressed ma guy, you need to feel more flour power *wink wink*

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The strange fortune cookie leaves.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: One of the coaches is approaching you, maybe they're here to check the stats… oh, they're here to gamble. That checks out.

nodes.speaker: coach
nodes.text: Every coach knows that the best way to support your fighter is through gambling. It shows an unbreakable bond. By that I mean I'll break their bones if they lose.

nodes.speaker: player
nodes.text: They say knowledge means power, and money also means power… by the law of commutativity, knowledge must mean money.

nodes.speaker: coach
nodes.text: Alright, alright. I've been around long enough to know a thing or two. What do you want to know?

choices.text: Get the info and thank him

nodes.speaker: coach
nodes.text: Boy, you think I started baking yesterday? I see right through your dirty little scheme…

nodes.speaker: player
nodes.text: It would be such a shame if, let's say, they found something in the lockers. Indeed a great shame that might require… financial compensation.

nodes.speaker: coach
nodes.text: Interesting. I see what you want me to do, kid. If you've got the chips, I'll do it.

nodes.speaker: coach
nodes.text: You want me to betray my fighter? Unacceptable! The only suspicious white powder they're gonna find is my homemade protein!

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: You leave the coach to his protein shake and poor life choices.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The referee stands tall, half sugar, half justice. The whistle gleams with a suspicious glaze.

nodes.speaker: referee
nodes.text: Rules? The first rule is: don’t get melted. The second rule: if you do, don’t scream too loud. It disturbs the customers.

nodes.speaker: referee
nodes.text: Welcome to the sweet life, kid. Sugarcoated on the outside, rotten dough on the inside.

nodes.speaker: referee
nodes.text: Bias? I call it fair! Unless someone pays better, of course. Hypothetically speaking.

nodes.speaker: referee
nodes.text: I’ll make sure your bets rise like dough in summer. You didn’t hear that from me.

nodes.speaker: referee
nodes.text: You trying to butter me up? You’re one coin short of a cupcake, friend.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: You step back, the referee’s whistle echoing like a judgement bell.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: A gingerbread man is pacing nervously, icing sweat dripping down his frosted brow.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: I can feel it… this next bet is the one. The chocolate gods owe me a win!

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Yeah! That’s the spirit. Nothing’s crumbling this time.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: You sound like my ex-cookie. I didn’t need that energy.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The gingerbread gambler returns to mumbling to himself.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: You spot a gingerbread woman shuffling cards with professional precision.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Years of losses teach you one thing — dough always wins.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Ha! I like your confidence. It’ll be gone after round one.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: You sure? Last person who tried that ended up dunked in coffee.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: She shuffles again, the sound like distant thunder in the sugar storm.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: This gingerbread looks like he hasn’t slept since the last bake-off.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Sleep? Can’t. What if someone bets against me while I blink?

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Sugar?! What do I look like, a donut? Get that weak stuff outta here.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: He twitches nervously, still staring at the betting board.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: A gingerbread elder sits quietly, watching the chaos with a knowing smile.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: We bake, we crumble, we rebuild. That’s the dough cycle, young one.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Beauty and sadness often share the same oven.

nodes.speaker: gingerbread
nodes.text: Ha! Finally someone honest. Go on, enjoy your crumble.

nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: The old cookie nods, his frosting beard glistening in the dim light.
